titleStmt.title: W. G. Reasor to James F. Robinson
CWG9054

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
To his Excellency James F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky.

Your petitioners respectfully represent to your excellency that the fine agt William Able, rendered in the case of the Commonwealth vS. Able in the Louisville Police Court ^Should be remitted.^ The fine was upon a forfeited recognizance. Said Able having been recognized to appear as a witness in said Court & failed to appear. We have every reason to believe, & do believe that said ^Able^ was sick at the time he failed to appear, & was confined to his bed by sickness & has been confined to his house ever since.

Mr Able forfeited a recognizance in the City Court of Louisville having been recognized in the sum of $100, to appear as a witness in the behalf of the comlth Mr Able is an old man, & a resident of Jefferson County some 12 miles from Louisville. Judging from the certificate of his Physician, who is well known, & think the fine should be remitted

Respectfully
W, G, Reasor
City Atto

Will be in in 10 minutes
Fields.
